data.title: A Michigan Win!!!
data.text: The harpist in the lounge sets the ambience . The bar exudes specialties from French martinis to Sazeracs . Then the gourmet food👍👍👍👍 but on Wolverine game days great imported beers and fantastic. Hamburgers are in vogue  can go wrong as a Victors

data.title: Old-fashioned in a good way.
data.text: Had a business breakfast here. Service was elegant and food surpassed most hotel dining room breakfasts. It's a lovely hotel to stay at. Having one meal here is suggested. Almost feels old-fashioned, in a good way.

data.title: victors-- a superb experience for allergic diners
data.text: Ambiance -excellent,Staff were beyond professional chef is allergic & advised us on the ingredients.

data.title: Pretty Good Food
data.text: The food has made an improvement over the last couple of years. Service is nice and menu has pretty good options

data.title: Had lunch and breakfast
data.text: Room had a nice feel. Room looks like it belongs in Georgetown. They close at 10 for dinner and not a minute later so plan accordingly. Very accommodating  wait staff. Eat there if you are staying at the hotel. Probably wouldn't go out of my way. However, the bar was cozy and looked like a very good place to have a conversation with someone that you really wanted to talk to.

data.title: Good food, but service can improve a bit
data.text:
I ate two breakfasts and one dinner - and liked the food - fresh ingredient, and yummy!
My only negative experience was when the original waiter failed to deliver one item repeatedly. Another one eventually brought it, but I wonder if it was just that waiter or something organic with the restaurant.

data.title: Always special
data.text: I see it has been three years or so since I reviewed Victors.  Love the atmosphere.  Quiet, elegant, but not fussy. Sometimes the food is great, sometimes good.  The onion rings, for example were divine once, fair on the next try.  Service is usually excellent. Four or five times a year I dine here.  The crab cake and risotto can be quite good.  I would pass on the fish and chips, however. Breakfast is a great bargain, dinner not so much.

data.title: Excellent lunch, great service!
data.text: Fish & Chips were great for a business lunch while at the Campus Inn for a seminar. Good service, hot food & good lunch menu. Elegant dining room.

data.title: Try the Crab Cakes!
data.text: It was a very cold evening when we arrived at the Inn and not wanting to venture out we checked out Victors. We had a very nice meal - i had the crab cakes which I thought were quite delicious. My daughter had the Cordon Bleu and reported it to be very tasty as well. We also ordered room service twice - the service was quick and the food was delivered hot and as ordered. The evening service was just ok - but the woman who seemed to be the manager was working hard to accommodate all the guests so kudos to her. The morning staff seemed quite friendly and welcoming and whenever I called for room service they were friendly and service oriented.

data.title: Great Local Lunch Spot
data.text: Campus Inn is a perfect spot to have a business meeting over lunch.  With a more elegant ambiance than most other establishments and an intimate atmosphere, it offers a comfortable spot for a business and personal meals.  The staff is friendly and polite, and the food is consistently good.

data.title: Needs to come to its potential
data.text:
We enjoyed a dinner here during a recent trip to Ann Arbor to see a Prairie Home Companion broadcast.  Menu is somewhat typical of a hotel menu, but with some pleasant surprises such as the Crepes Caponata appetizer, which was sort of an eggplant cannoli.  Went for the filet mignon at the recommendation of the waiter but it was overcooked (medium rare was served medium).  We ate early, and were one of only two couples dining at the time, so you'd think that the kitchen could've gotten this right.  Would've ordered a second glass of wine, but our waiter sort've disappeared after the main plates were served.  Also only presented with a wine-by-glass menu, and never advised that there was a fuller bottle menu available.

There are a lot of upscale dining choices in Ann Arbor, and this place might have a chance to be one of them if they work a little harder at it.

data.title: Nothing too special
data.text: I had breakfast and lunch here, and it was typical hotel food.  The prices were reasonable for a hotel restaurant, and the service was friendly and helpful.  Not inspiring, but acceptable in a pinch.

data.title: Good food /Good price
data.text: For a hotel restaurant this was surprisingly nice. Breakfast was delicious (Eggs Benedict) and dinner had a nicely variety of foods to choose from at all different price points. Had things for adults and kids.

data.title: Excellent food and ambiance
data.text: The steak was phenomenal and the wine selection fantastic.  The atmosphere was perfect for a relaxing meal and ability to talk and relax.  The wait staf was attentive yet new when not to interrupt.

data.title: Disappointing!!!
data.text: I tried this place again after a few years away.  The food looks good but tastes awful- inedible chicken and fish.  The waitstaff was fine but the food should keep you away!!!

data.title: A quiet relaxing dinner with a surprise!
data.text:
On a Friday night in Ann Arbor we were surprised to find ourselves the only diners in this restaurant. We were staying close by and wanted to be able to walk to dinner.We started with warm rolls and home made potatoe soup. The chicken cordon bleu was the best we ever tasted. The waiter explained that it would take an extra 25 minutes to prepare as the chicken is rolled by hand and made fresh. Definately worth the wait!
We look forward to going back to our private dining spot.

data.title: Should I Tell
data.text:
As a local, I'm uncertain whether to open this quiet, classy spot up to the invading dining onslaught, BUT...Victor's is a great place for
a relaxing, inspiring, tasteful meal with super service.  Hadn't been there for probably 20 years, didn't even know it still existed,  YES, it does
and I highly recommend it for a special adult evening's dinner.  Fine and varied menu, same for cocktails and wine.  No noise, plenty of
server attention and a real chance to talk.  WHY you ask.  My understanding--not personal experience--is that it's full for breakfasts and
sometimes lunch, but that for those at the hotel (The Campus Inn) in the evenings there are more exciting, on-the-town venues to experience.
At Victor's any diners, from singles to large groups, would be comfortable.  No high energy music, light shows or celebrity browsing, but
a good meal, well-served, just off the first floor lobby, with easy parking and excellent access for all ages and abilites.  Try it or like me, try it again and make some more happy memories.

data.title: Spectacular
data.text: Tried the Black Bean Soup today and it is spectacular! This coming from a Brazilian woman is a a really big complement! Service is just perfect - as always.

data.title: Desserts and service are excellent!
data.text: I must say that my husband and I have yet to have a dinner here, but the desserts are fabulous -- and I am not a dessert person!  The three berry pie with homemade cinnamon ice cream was absolutely fabulous.  Took more than my usual three forksful from my husband!  The carrot cake was also terrific!  The bartender was amazed that my husband finished almost all of it with just a little help from me.  The bartender was friendly and funny as was the very nice lady eating a scrumptious looking salad with a great looking merlot!

data.title: Good Food and Gracious Staff
data.text: Everything is made to order, delicious, and artfully presented. The chocolate truffles are to die for!
